intro: Tithymalus buchtormensis, commonly known as the Buchtor Mountains tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. It is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
